TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is a NORP .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant , together with a group of other NORP , was praying on private LOC , namely in a house rented by a non - governmental organisation whose leader was the applicant . They were dispersed by the police and the applicant was subsequently charged with the offence ( contravenţie administrativă ) of practising a religion which was not recognised by the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found the applicant guilty on the basis of LAW and fined him CARDINAL Moldovan lei ( MDL ) . The applicant appealed against this decision and argued , inter alia , that it was contrary to his right to freedom of religion .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal without giving any reasons and without inviting the applicant to attend the hearing .
CARDINAL . DATE of LAW , concerning freedom of conscience , provides :
“ CARDINAL . Freedom of conscience is guaranteed . It must be manifested in a spirit of tolerance and mutual respect .
CARDINAL . Freedom of worship is guaranteed . Religious denominations shall organise themselves according to their own articles of association , in compliance with the law .
CARDINAL . Any manifestation of discord is forbidden in relations between religious denominations .

CARDINAL . Religious denominations shall be autonomous and separated from the ORG , and shall enjoy the latter ’s support , including facilities granted for the purpose of providing religious assistance in the army , hospitals , prisons , mental institutions and orphanages . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW , as published in ORG no . DATE , read as follows :
“ In order to be able to organise and operate , denominations must be recognised by means of a government decision .
Where a denomination fails to comply with the conditions laid down by the first paragraph of section CARDINAL of the present Act , recognition may be withdrawn under the same procedure . ”

This section was amended in DATE . According to the amendments , in order to be recognised a denomination had to submit to the Government a declaration and a series of documents . After submitting the declaration and the documents , the denomination would be registered within DATE .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW reads as follows :
“ The practising ... of unlawful [ religious ] beliefs or rituals is punishable by a fine in the amount of ORG CARDINAL - CARDINAL . ”
On DATE this Code will be replaced by MONEY which contains a similar provision in its LAW .
